page.title: 19Events-Biddestone
page.content: A fete is held on the village green in June each year. The money raised is shared between the Church and various clubs in the village such as the football club, and the Brownies. Donations are given to the W.I Harvest tea and to the Biddestone Broadsheet. The fete is run by a committee. It is usually opened by some notable personality to attract people from far away. There are several stalls selling handicrafts,cakes, secondhand books, bric-a brac,etc. There are games of skill and chance,and a raffle with valuable donated prizes. Lunches are served on the Green and home-made teas either in a farmhouse or a marquee. In some years a barn dance is held in the marquee in the evening.
